snippet: Workday, which sells sells cloud-based software for enterprise tech applications, had a hugely successful I.P.O. Friday. A co-founder, Aneel Bhusri, sees a "20-year cycle" between incumbents, like Oracle and SAP, and upstarts like Workday.
abstract: Workday, which sells sells cloud-based software for enterprise tech applications, had a hugely successful I.P.O. Friday. A co-founder, Aneel Bhusri, sees a "20-year cycle" between incumbents, like Oracle and SAP, and upstarts like Workday.

headline.main: Workday's I.P.O.: 'The Incumbents Are Not Prepared'
